Cool idea! Maybe it could be added as "custom concrete" or "custom wool" and so on. :)
Diorite is my fave stone!
Already stone tools are useless - they're just a stepping stone to iron. This would just saturate the tiered progression of tools unnecessarily.
I would agree with you MacchuPicchu but I makes sense to me at least. Plus saying that this shouldn't be in game is like saying having an Iron or Diamond Hoe shouldn't be craftable at all.

Moved to proper category.

Thanks for your contribution.
I like it
Well some of this is already a previous suggestion in the website so you should support them: Placeable Gunpowder

I think it should be more like this:

Multi Shot 2 = 4 projectiles

Multi Shot 3 = 5 projectiles

This way it won't be that op.

Cool idea! Hard to think how it would work with different Arrow types, though.

What would also be nice: To let the extra arrows be inaccurate, so they would randomly spread out in all directions and deal a bit less damage than the main Arrow, which will Always remain accurate and straight.

Multi-shot I - 3 additional projectiles (50% damage of main Arrow)
Multi-shot II - 5 additional projectiles (75% damage of main Arrow) 

Durations of effects would also be affected, maybe.
@Quinten Smit Honestly your idea bro doesn't sound like the upgrade version of Multi Shot and sounds like a Power enchantment. That's just my opinion though.

Thanks for your contribution.
I like it
I'd love to see Wither Roses spawn in Nether Wastes. I'd never leave! (Yeah, they're in Pots all over my houses in every World)
You can do that with Item Frames.

Item frames do not allow multiple items to be placed in place of a block. Also, I don't want to hang an item on the wall, why should I waste leather and sticks if I just want to put the item on the floor or table so it doesn't disappear?

Sorry but there's a post saying just that. Go over there and support if  you really want this.

Make the Power Enchantment Compatible to the Crossbow
You can use a crossbow with your shield up, so I think they should still have a lower damage potential than bows do, so the player has to choose between higher damage or better defense.
I’ve wanted these for so long. Would be so cool for builds like lighthouses
Spotlights are very useful, they can be used to display objects and make horror maps!
Would be amazing to light up the side of a skyscraper!

I don't understand, is the light beam shrinking on your diagram? Wouldn't that be more logic if it was spreading (and maybe losing intensity) instead? Normally, the higher a spotlight is, the larger is the light spot.

Now that Mojang plans to add crystal/amethyst, which is used to craft telescopes, it could be used to craft floodlights too! (I was thinking about lenses made with a half-diamond before they announced the Caves & Cliffs Update.) It adds a new reason to find and exploit geodes, and it makes sense because spotlights are powerful.
There should be a shadow effect from on;y this light source.

i was about to post the same. also had a thought, what if the spotlight effect was a modifier block? a LENS?

so.. place a torch, then a 'LENS' block. the lens block then takes the light input and sends it as far in that direction as possible, until the light hits a block or travels 'x' chunks.

i<           dark, dark, dark      lit []

the benefit of the 'lens' block is that redstone signals could then be transferred 'wirelessly' a redstone lamp at either end of the 'lens' block chain would transfer their states over 'x' ticks

Rtx<                                                                 >Rrx

observers could also benefit. 

Bamboo<                                                          >Observer
This could give another function for amethyst too
Using an item that can never be obtained again just for a banner. I say no.
Yes a dragon of wales symbol would look nice
Maybe an end crystal instead of a dragon egg.
I think it should be a dragon head, not a dragon egg
Where's the Grim Reaper?
Maybe not only that but removing the additional xp cost to rename the item

As well as iron and gold items can be smelted back into nuggets, leather should be reworked into leather scraps or similar following the path where 9 scraps would make a whole leather. That would make a whole lot more sense.
My mob grinder is full of useless leather armor from monsters. I'd love to be able to recycle it.

Good idea!

This is a really cool idea, but it is still possible to use water to build downwards. If you are in the nether, this would be more useful, but you could still use lava and fire resistance. Great idea, though!
How spooky.
It would be nice if this worked well with the flute (clay) block, as it could be sustained by linking a bunch of them together with one-tick repeaters.
I think Soul Sand already has a sound, so Soul Soil would be the block that has the choir sound.

This is such a cool idea, I absolutely love it!

Do you think something like Jack O'Lanterns would make a particular noise, or would affect that single voice somehow?

Maybe one's an "oo" and one's an "ah"

some oo oo ah ahs, could spice up a nice old song
Or the sound could be like the vox humana sound on an organ.
sounds interesting. Flintlocks or magic?
@machandler it’s magic but ya a simple flintlock stronger than a crossbow could work using lead -new item using stone + flint-  and gunpowder
Reeds should be planted in one block deep water, not next to water to make it more realistic.
This is fantastic! Just what I was thinking.
It'd also be cool if you could stick a small sail into the middle, too!

I don't think a lifeboat would fit in Minecraft, but I think a dinghy would. So are you thinking more of a dinghy?

On the placing certain blocks in I think it should be like this.

  • Crafting Table & Variants - 1 seat
  • Chest - 1 seat
  • Bed - 2 seats
  • Torch - 0 seats

So if you have a chest you can only hold 4 people/mobs.

This means that you have to prioritize what you want.

So you could have a crafting table, chest, bed, and a torch in your dinghy.

I was imagining this would be the kind of lifeboat that was used as a safety measure on ships, like this. (though a dinghy would work too).  I should have been more clear about that.  As for your idea about placing blocks, I think that would be great, but if the boat was as large as I imagined it, it may only be able to hold 3 people when there is clearly room for more.  Maybe every 2 blocks should be equivalent to 1 seat instead.
@ChipsNachos, ah, I see, yeah that could work :)
maybe to breed zombies and zombie variants

I agree with making them useful in some way.  My thought was also for a potion, since, in the real world, some brands of vodka are made with potatoes, maybe the potion that temporarily affects vision and or stability.  poshtado poshun! 🤪
Either for a potion of nausea or to breed mobs like creepers, zombies, and spiders.
I was just thinking about posting this, why weren’t carrots added to the game like this, right?
Agreed. Why do beetroots have seeds but not carrots? It doesn't make sense.
While we are at it, Wheat has the opposite peculiarity, wheat seeds are the part of wheat eaten, they should not be two different items
I agree. I was going to post this as well. Unlike potatoes - carrots have seeds.
Silverfish are a real life, kinda gross, bug that tend to infest books and other paper products. I'm surprised by how many people don't know this and think they are only a minecraft mob.

I really miss this since I ve moved from Java to bedrock. Exploring caves with this is such a pleasure, so I can't wait of this.

It should be done long time ago.
